definition: showy boxing of no practical use/see 花拳繡腿|花拳绣腿
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
flowery of fist with fancy footwork (idiom)/highly embellished and ineffectual/fancy but impractical skills/all show and no go/pugilistic wankery
Meihua Quan - "Plum Blossom Fist" (Chinese Martial Art)

sentences.english: The basic training methods of Meihuaquan are simple and strong yet relaxed and highly adaptable.
sentences.chinese: 梅花拳的训练过程简便严格，又随意自然。

sentences.english: Luxuriant translation is like nice-looking but phony boxing, pleasant to the eyes, useless as practice.
sentences.chinese: 华丽的译文就象花拳秀腿，看得顺眼，学了无用。

sentences.english: During the uprising, the Plum Flower Boxers renamed themselves the “Righteous and Harmonious Fists”.
sentences.chinese: 在义和团运动中，梅花拳更名为“义和拳”。

sentences.english: But locals reckon that Plum Flower Boxing could give them a boost.
sentences.chinese: 但当地人认为，梅花拳能改善他们的境遇。

sentences.english: Meihuazhuang (can are traslate Plum Blossom Piles ) is a branch of Meihuaquan.
sentences.chinese: 梅花桩是梅花拳的一种。

definition: flowery of fist with fancy footwork (idiom)/highly embellished and ineffectual/fancy but impractical skills/all show and no go/pugilistic wankery
Ba Ji Quan "Eight Extremes Fist" - Martial Art
Changquan - Northern Shaolin (北少林) - Longfist - Martial Art
Wing Chun/same as 詠春拳|咏春拳[yong3 chun1 quan2]/Yongchun - "Singing Spring Fist" (Chinese martial art)

military skill or technique (in former times)/all kinds of martial art sports (some claiming spiritual development)/self-defense/tradition of choreographed fights from opera and film (recent usage)/also called kungfu 功夫/CL:種|种[zhong3]
Di Tang Quan - "Ground-Prone Fist"/"Ground Tumbling Boxing" - Martial Art
Tantui, a northern school of martial arts boxing
